OPTION.TOOLTIP: Display banner and function progress information
OPTION.ODESC: Display progress information and toolset version when executing.
Suppress common compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated, as well as feature specific status.
Suppress all compiler non-diagnostic output. Remarks, errors and warnings will still be generated.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate C source interlisted assembly file

OPTION.ODESC: Print out the compiler release revision and exit.
Pre-define the symbol NAME, optionally setting it's contents to 'value'.
Show usage information. When followed by another option or a phrase display that option's detailed information, or search for options related to that phrase.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Keep the generated assembly language (.asm) file

OPTION.ODESC: Do not generate .clink directives for const global arrays. By default these arrays are placed in a .const subsection and conditionally linked.
After compiling all the source files, perform a link and pass all the options following this option to the linker.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Print version numbers for each tool

OPTION.ODESC: All template entities are instantiated as needed in the file. The instantiations are given internal (static) linkage.

Generate a dependency list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp Optionally, name the output file. The output will include all files included in the source file as well as any of the files included. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the dependency list (ala gcc).

Generate an include list for the source file into the file <filename>.pp Optionally, name the output file. The output will include only those files directly included by the source file. Also see the -ppa option to continue compilation after generating the include list (ala gcc).

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate a preprocessed file and continue compilation

OPTION.ODESC: This option enables the support for GCC extensions

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Place each function in a separate subsection
Specify how to treat plain chars (signed/unsigned)

OPTION.ODESC: Include the source code of the indicated file at the beginning of the compilation. This can be used to establish standard macro definitions, etc. The file name is searched for in the directories on the include search list. Within each group, the files are processed in the order in which they were specified.
Specify silicon core version.

MUTEX.MNAME: Mutually Exclusive Group: Prioritize speed/space optimizations

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Assume called funcs create hidden aliases (rare)

OPTION.ODESC:
Specify assumptions to make about function calls when optimizing.
Level 0 (-op0) indicates that the module has functions that are called from other modules.
Level 1 (-op1) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called by other modules but has global variables that are modified in other modules.
Level 2 (-op2) indicates that the module does not have functions that are called or globals that are modified by other modules.
Level 3 (-op3) indicates that the module has functions that are called by other modules but does not have globals that are modified by other modules.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate optimizer information file at level [0-2]
OPTION.ODESC: Set the optimizer information file level, or disable with 0. Level 1 includes basic information. Level 2 includes detailed information. The file will be created in the assembly directory if a custom asm directory is specified on the command line otherwise it will be created in the object file directory.

Set compiler optimization level.
Level 0 includes register optimizations. Level 1 adds local optimizations. Level 2 further adds global optimizations. Level 3 further adds interprocedure optimizations.
Using -O without arguments defaults to -O2.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Optimize fully in the presence of debug directives
Generate optimized source interlisted assembly file

OPTION.ODESC: Inline function that are called only once. Will inline these functions even if auto inlining has been turned off (-oi0)

Printf/sprintf functions use a common low level routine, _printfi which processes a given printf format string. The full version of _printfi provides formatting capabalities that are not required in typical embedded applications. To address this the C runtime library also includes two limited of versions of _printfi that provide a useful subset of the formatting features specified by C library standard.
One version excludes support for printing floating values. All format specifiers except for %f, %g, %G, %e, or %E are supported. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=nofloat' when linking.
The other version only supports printing of integer,char, or string values without width or precision flags. Only %%, %d, %o, %c, %s and %x are supportd. To specify this version use the option '--printf_support=minimal' when linking.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: File contains an RTS library function.
File does not define any RTS library func (def.)
File redefines an RTS library function.

OPTION.ODESC: Pre-define the assembly symbol NAME, optionally setting its contents to 'value'.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Generate first-level assembly include file list
Keep local symbols in output file
File is an assembly file (default for .asm)
File is a C file (default for .c/no ext)
File is a C++ file (default for .C .cpp .cc)
File is an object file (default for .obj)
Treat C files as C++ files
Produce an absolute, executable object file (default)
Specify the program entry point for the output module
Set default fill value for holes in output sections
Specify heap size for C/C++ dynamic memory allocation
Ignore alignment flags specified in input sections
Include library file or command file as input

OPTION.ODESC: Display usage information. Followed by another option, will display detailed information on that option.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Produce listing of input and output sections in <file>
Disable type merging in symbolic debugging information
Strip symbol table and line number entries

OPTION.ODESC: Full filename of the output file.
Alter the library-search algorithm to look in dir before looking in the default location. This option must appear before the -l option.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Add <sym> to symbol table as an unresolved symbol
Link in hardware version of RTS mpy routine
OPTION.ODESC: Replaces all references to the default integer/long multiply routines with the version of the multiply routine that uses the hardware multiplier

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Link in 32-bit hardware version of RTS mpy routine
OPTION.ODESC: Replaces all references to the default integer/long multiply routines with the version of the multiply routine that uses the 32-bit hardware multiplier.

OPTION.TOOLTIP: Warn if an unspecified output section is created
Produce detailed link information data-base in <file>
